intro: Thymus × josephi-angeli nothosubsp. josephi-angeli, commonly known as the hybrid thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, aromatic, needle-like leaves and produces clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, exhibiting drought tolerance once established. Its botanical classification highlights its origin as a natural hybrid between Thymus species.
